name: 黃如瑩
objective: 本課程透過希臘英雄的偉大冒險故事以及希伯來聖經傳統中的聖哲事蹟來探索早期西方文明的兩大源頭（希臘與希伯來文化）所呈現出的主要風貌。
schedule:
Introduction to Western Literature and Culture (2009.9)
西洋文學文化導讀
Instructor:  Ju-ying Vinia Huang 黃如瑩
E-mail: vinia@ntut.edu.tw
Facebook: Ju-ying Vinia Huang  http://www.facebook.com
Google blogger: http//ju-ying-vinia-huang.blogspot.com
Telephone: 27712171ext.3942
Office hours: Mon. 10:00—12:00; Tues. 14:00—16:00
Class Schedule:  Monday 1:10 pm –4:00pm
Classroom:  General Education Building 715
Vinia’s Office: General Education Building 409 四樓系辦對面
I.  What literary texts are we going to read in this class?
1. (    ) Greek and Roman mythology:
(1) Greek tales of Gods and Heroes
(2) Ovid’s Metamorphoses
2.(    ) Greek epic:
(1)Homer’s The Iliad
(2)Homer’s The Odyssey
3. (    ) Greek tragedies:
(1)	Aeschylus’s Agamemnon
(2)	Sophocles’s Oedipus the King
(3)	Euripides’s Medea
4. (    ) Aesop’s fables
5. (    ) Stories from The Old Testament
6. (    ) Stories from The New Testament
II.  What are the requirements of this class?
1. Attendance (20%): Each absence (w/o proper reasons) costs 5%, four un-permitted absences STARTING FROM THE BEGINNING OF THE SEMESTER, i.e., the first week, will lead to FAILURE in this course. Clinic receipt, parents’ letter, and NTUT class adviser’s proof are all accepted
2. Group/individual presentation in the class (10%): total 12 groups
3.	Weekly quizzes (40%)
4.	Mid-term examination (15%):  a test on the Greek culture and literature
Please upload your answers to our Website.
5.	Final exam (15%): an exam on Biblical literature and Hebrew culture
Please upload your answers to our Website.
III.	What textbook(s) are we going to use?
1.	Unveiling Greek Mythology I & II
2.	For group presentation: Stories from Homer; A Collection of Aesop’s Fables
3.	Bible stories from the Old testament and the New Testament
IV. Syllabus
(1) 9/14     Introduction to the history of western civilization;
An evaluation of students’ western cultural background knowledge
